newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican exports seen up 20 pct in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Mexican exports seen up 20 pct in 1997.

text.p: Mexican exports are seen growing by 20 percent in 1997 to $120 billion, the official news agency Notimex reported on Tuesday, quoting an official with the Trade Ministry.

Rocio Ruiz Chavez, director of services for foreign trade with the Trade Ministry, also known as SECOFI, told a meeting of exporters in the northern industrial city of Monterrey that Mexico would post its second straight year of solid export growth in 1997.
Exports this year are expected to total $100 billion, up 25 percent from 1995.
"Next year the growth in exports will continue but at a slower pace than in 1996, and our projections are for growth on the order of 20 percent," Notimex quoted Ruiz Chavez as saying.
